creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
There's two things wrong with fixcrlf errors, that makes troubleshooting tricky.

1. they dont identify the task at fault. You have to work it out from the line
number of the current build file, which can get tricky in a big build.

2. if a source or directory is invalid, the task doesn't print out the current
value of the attribute for easy diagnostics of the problem.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
